result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb R Mansfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution joint/several with co-defendant. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a HSED during the pendency of probation term.
No contact with B. Danielson, R. Moss or James Johnston directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.

records.addlTxt: SDCNI returned         wm
Revoked-Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC

10:55 am case called. Defendant Caleb R Mansfield in court with attorney Patricia A. Baker.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. Clarifications stated by Attorney Baker. Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Baker. Defendant makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to: EACH COUNT- 8 month WCJ, With Huber and Good time Credit. Credit for 115 days time served.  Concurrent to each other and Court does not object to jail transfer. Court re-imposes costs to be repaid within 60 days or payment plan. Court will reduce restitution of $340 to a civil judgment-joint/several.
Inmate requests to the Court dated July 15, 2018 and July 19, 2018 - Re: Sentencing hearing after revocation and credit for time served - the Court will address at the August 10, 2018 hearing

Case called @ 4:33 p.m. Defendant Caleb R Mansfield in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Cts 1 & 2 to Misdemeanor Theft contrary to Wis Stat 943.20(1)(a) as a PTAC.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation concurrent with any other sentence currently being served - Conditions: As to Ct 1 only - 20 days WC Jail consecutive to any other sentence currently being served - Huber, No GT, 5 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 11/1/2016. As to both counts - Rest in the amount of $340 - J/S w/ co-defendant, Defendant to obtain a HSED, NC w/ B. Danielson, R. Moss and/or James Johnston, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

02:01 pm case called. Defendant Caleb R Mansfield in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters plea of Not Guilty to all counts.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:10 pm.
